page.title: 09ENERGY
page.content:
Although{gas}provides an economic fuel for urban districts, the area is too remote and too sparsely populated for it to pay the gas company to lay on gas to villages or farms.
{Electricity}was laid on to the village and some of the surrounding farms in 1928. Originally provided mainly for lighting (at an installation charge of 30 shillings per light!),it now provides an important energy source for a whole range of uses - cooking, heating, audio/video equipment etc.
Some homes depend on{coal}or{oil}for heating and hot water. These are delivered by suppliers in Rushden or Bedford.
